embeds.title: Golden Bullet
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 3 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 18 (24) damage.
If **Fatal**, permanently reduce this card's cost by 1.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: @Nic200
It's my time to shine
1000 word essay, go
challenge accepted.
fr tho well thought out essays are gud

So, Golden Bullet is probably the best act one pickup for hermit. The earlier you get this the better, as the first 3 combats are from an easier pool and will have less health/damage, so they are prime bullet targets.

The first combat where it costs 3 energy is the toughest. However it is 18 damage, and with the vuln that brings you up to 27 damage. That is enough to take out a lot of early game enemies from full hp. Absolutely shreds louses, does about half of a jaw worm's health, almost kills medium slimes, can 1 tap rats, does half of a thieve's health bar.
So you can easily get these enemies into 1 tap range and end the combat with this card (for aoe fights if it is still 2-3 cost it is best to save it for the last enemy) lowering its cost.

Usually after 3-5 combats it will be 0 cost. At this point it is middle of act 1 and you have a 0 cost 18 damage exhausting card. This can be used to chunk over 1/3 of a sentry's hp, hit nob and laga real goodly, and do 10-15% damage to a boss.

Of course this is all unupgraded, I'd say the card is a pretty high priority upgrade, as +6 damage for 0 energy is pretty good, sometimes I'll upgrade it before it reaches 0 if I pick it up late into act 1 or early act 2 to help guarantee those kills, as with vuln it goes from 27 to 36 damage.
I'll continue this later after my lunch
I must admit, I cannot agree more
https://tenor.com/view/bird-to-be-continued-gif-10576125
I'm back!
Nic jumpscare

So this card now is a 0 cost 24 damage absolute hunk of direct damage. Do you know what else is a 0 cost 24 damage absolute hunk of a damage card? Nothing really, except kinda <sunder> but you still need to have 3 energy to be able to play it.

embeds.title: Sunder
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 3 :blue_energy: / The Defect / Slay the Spire

Deal 24 (32) damage.
If this kills an enemy, gain :blue_energy: :blue_energy: :blue_energy:.

messages.content: This just becomes "take out a whole ass enemy in aoe fights or chunk the boss for 36 damage"
And the only real downside is it exhausts (which admittedly a lot of hermit's best damage cards exhaust, so this is a problem) and getting it to 0 cost, which isn't honestly that bad.
This won't win you the boss fight, but it gets you there with more hp and allows you to take more cards that will work well against bosses.

I never get this card early enough but once it becomes even 18 damage for 2 energy it’s good

A very time sensitive card pick, but certainly powerful. Fantastic if found early in act 1, even just reducing the cost to 2 is reasonable in the elite fights, and you are fairly likely to reduce the cost by more than that. I am still usually willing to take these in the second half of act 1, and even sometimes at the start of act 2. You do have to keep in mind though that while 18 damage for 0 energy is pretty excellent, this is still just front loaded damage, and you only have so much room in your deck for damage cards. Eventually you will need to shift more into mitigation and scaling for the later acts, so if you find early golden bullets, great, but you really shouldn't be taking it later than halfway through act 2.

As a front loaded damage card, it's probably one of hermits best. Getting the cost reduced is pretty easy, largely thanks to your starting memento, and the relatively low health of early game enemies. It does exhaust, but I actually think that's largely beneficial (in the same way that carnage having ethereal is largely beneficial), because in the short fights, it doesn't matter since you won't be reshuffling, and in the long fights, you want to thin your deck of these sorts of front-loaded damage cards anyways. The upgrade is interesting, it makes it even easier to lower the cost, and is a massive +6 on an eventual 0 cost card, but there is a clear tradeoff. Since golden bullet exhausts, that +6 makes you much better at short fights, but upgrading a different card (smoking barrel, ghostly presence, magnum, tracking shot, vantage, etc) would still improve your short fights, while also being helpful in the medium and long fights. My general opinion is that I would prefer to upgrade a non-exhausting card, but I might upgrade golden bullet if I really needed help in short fights, or if I picked it up particularly late and it was going to be more difficult to stack due to enemies having higher hp.

Has some slight synergies with dead-on as a 0 cost card that can easily rearrange your hand. Plays well with bruise to make it easier to stack and because it's a cheap attack, great with runic pyramid to stack it up. I think overall golden bullet is probably too powerful, especially if you can find some copies early enough, but it's hard to really suggest a nerf, since lowering the damage would make it much harder to use. As long as hermit has on demand vulnerable with their starting relic (and I really like old locket for the record, it plays really well with several of hermits themes, and makes for interesting decision), this will always be a strong card.
yeah I do not think hermit's starter should be changed at all. It will make some things stronger, but that's fine by me. It plays into his character so well.
the "risk" of taking damage showing his aggressive tendencies that can lead to health loss, the debuff package, the extra damage on demand, it's a curse so it works for cursed cloak
it is one of the best designed starting relics in all of downfall, and probably does a better job at conveying the characters gimmicks better than even base game casts.
